definition: to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Four people enter looking around in a curios way.
sentences.chinese: 有四个人走了进来，好奇的四处张望。

sentences.english: Eero stopped suddenly and looked around.
Looked far from rear, he stood high.
It was half past ten. Sarie watched the path anxiously .
sentences.chinese: 十点半钟的时候，莎莉焦急地朝着小路张望。

sentences.english: I ran to a hole in the wall and looked through .
sentences.chinese: 我跑到一个射击孔前向外张望。

sentences.english: Everyone who looked inside could only see his or her face.
sentences.chinese: 每个朝里面张望的人，都只看到自己的脸。

sentences.english: Looking around, seeked for the metro.
LIFE】A Chinese tourist steals a glimpse of the Palace Museum inside Beijing’s Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 一位游客偷偷张望北京紫禁城内的故宫博物馆。

sentences.english: I stepped into the bedroom and looked around, but there seemed to be nothing out of the ordinary.
sentences.chinese: 我走进卧室，朝四下里张望，没看见有什么异常。

sentences.english: inquired one pigeon of another which was peering over the edge of the north parapet.
sentences.chinese: 一只鸽子问另一只经常往北边防护矮墙张望的鸽子。

sentences.english: They look into the beauty of thy mind.
sentences.chinese: 触向你心神之纵深处张望。

sentences.english: The horse pricked up her ears, and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 马竖起耳朵，向四处张望。

sentences.english: Melanie leaves the kitchen and notices Ted looking around in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 梅勒妮离开了厨房，注意到特德正在大厅里四处张望。

sentences.english: Therefore, I reluctantly looked back, it is a desolate lies.
sentences.chinese: 所以我恋恋不舍回头张望，绿水青山却是一片苍凉。

sentences.english: Tom glanced impatiently around the garage.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆不耐烦地向车行四面张望。

sentences.english: Another contestant asked me why I was just standing there looking around.
sentences.chinese: 另一个参赛者问我为什么站着，只四处张望。

definition: to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to peep/to spy on
everywhere
glancing to left and right (idiom); to look all around
to shade one's eyes with one's hand
to look around
all around
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
to see
old variant of 瞅[chou3]
(dialect) to look at
to extend one's head (out or into)/a probe/detector/search unit
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to take a furtive look at
to turn one's head/to turn around
to espy/to spot
